title: Itchen Valley Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Hugh Venables / Ditch in Itchen Valley Country Park
images.caption: Ditch in Itchen Valley Country Park. This area is very good for Damselflies, including the nationally scarce Southern Damselfly

images.title: Hugh Venables / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Itchen Valley Country Park visitor centre

images.title: Hugh Venables / River Itchen
images.caption: River Itchen in the park. Track is private due to fishing interests. Baffle on the right is to create slack water for fish. Taken from the bridge between two parts of the country park

images.title: Line of trees, Itchen Nature Reserve by David Martin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Line of trees, Itchen Nature Reserve

images.title: Eastleigh, Itchen Way by Mike Faherty, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Eastleigh, Itchen Way. On the western side of the park.

description: Explore 440 acres of parkland in this attractive country park in Southampton. There are numerous walking trails and an off road cycle trail running through the park. The park contains a 250 acre water meadow nature reserve, 90 acres of ancient woodland and 60 acres of grazing land. The River Itchen also runs through the park. The park has excellent facilities with a Visitor Centre built in the style of a 17th Century Hampshire Aisle Barn. The centre houses a gift shop and various interactive displays. To continue your walking you can pick up the Itchen Way long distance trail or visit the nearby Lakeside Country Park in Eastleigh .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The on site Woodland Café serves an excellent range of fresh, locally sourced, delicious food and hot drinks.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland area fine place for a dog walk. You will probably meet other owners on your visit. There is a popular dogwash facility and the cafe mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Also in the city you can head to Southampton Common on the western side of the river. The expansive common is great for walking with miles of trails and several pretty lakes. In the city centre you can pick up the Southampton Walls Walk and learn about the history of the old city walls. For more walking ideas in the area see the Hampshire Walks page.
